document.title: Wisconsin's Model Academic Standards for Technology Education

4A2758D0DFE80131F62568A86D17958E.description: Identify the advantages, disadvantages, risks, and benefits of given technologies

4A271C50DFE80131F62468A86D17958E.description: Evaluate and explain the impact people have had on the earth, including plant and animal life, through the development and introduction of technologies

4A26DEF0DFE80131F62368A86D17958E.description: Identify instances where technologies have had benefits and applications that no one predicted when they were first invented

4A269DA0DFE80131F62268A86D17958E.description: Explain how given technologies make life and work easier, but also how they may make them more complicated

4A265020DFE80131F62168A86D17958E.description: Identify new problems which result from using tools, materials, and processes to solve existing problems

comments: People develop and use technology to enhance their quality of life. Technologies like the automobile, nuclear power, genetic engineering, and factory automation have enhanced our mobility, enabled us to harness new energy resources, increased food production, reduced disease, and freed people from tedious or dangerous tasks. While each of these technologies has very distinct advantages, they also have clear disadvantages that need to be weighed carefully by those who live in a technological society. Given the rapid growth in technological capability, it is important that every citizen take an active role in promoting the common good by making informed decisions about risks and benefits of technology. To be active citizens, students need to understand the positive and negative impacts of technology on society and the environment. They need to weigh carefully the benefits and risks of technologies, and make informed decisions about technological issues.
4A2608C0DFE80131F62068A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will understand that technology affects society and the environment in ways that are both planned and unplanned and desirable and undesirable.

4A258B40DFE80131F61E68A86D17958E.description: Develop abilities in technological design and engineering around simple constraints

4A250950DFE80131F61C68A86D17958E.description: Approach problem and opportunity situations given a set of constraints and illustrate possible solutions using basic design principles

4A24C320DFE80131F61B68A86D17958E.description: Explain why people work collaboratively to design and produce products

4A246C10DFE80131F61A68A86D17958E.description: Use tools and materials to design, develop, or improve products that satisfy human wants and needs

4A241E20DFE80131F61968A86D17958E.description: Show how modern inventions and innovations have evolved as a result of new knowledge and technology

4A23D620DFE80131F61868A86D17958E.description: Examine products and processes and communicate how that product or process solved a human need or want

4A238610DFE80131F61768A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will be able to define problems, gather information, explore options, devise a solution, evaluate the outcome, and communicate the results.
comments: Humans have historically been involved in technological activity. We use our knowledge, physical ability, and technology to solve problems and seize opportunity. The design, development, and use of technological items is a direct result of human resourcefulness. When a new technology is introduced and opportunities are acted upon, the technology begins to evolve bringing more opportunity and still more problems to solve.

4A22E200DFE80131F61568A86D17958E.description: Explain how tools and materials are used to provide services and create products

4A227BA0DFE80131F61468A86D17958E.description: Follow a set of instructions to produce a product using appropriate tools and materials

4A224030DFE80131F61368A86D17958E.description: Identify and compare enterprises as technological systems

4A2203F0DFE80131F61268A86D17958E.description: Explain how systems depend on a variety of resources to produce a desirable outcome

4A21C4E0DFE80131F61168A86D17958E.description: Describe various reasons systems may fail; such as, overuse, lack of proper maintenance or management, improper design, or other natural or unnatural factors that may occur

4A218410DFE80131F61068A86D17958E.description: Identify the parts of a system and explain how the parts working together allow the system to do things the individual parts are unable to do alone

4A2143D0DFE80131F60F68A86D17958E.description: Identify and categorize systems that provide food, clothing, shelter, entertainment, health care, security, and other necessities and comforts of life

4A20F580DFE80131F60E68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will recognize that systems are made up of individual components and that each component affects the operation of the system and its relationship to other systems.
comments: Technological systems have always been a part of daily life. Recently, they have become more apparent because of their sophistication and influence. By coordinating and processing resources, these systems help to provide products and services such as food, clothing, shelter, entertainment, health care, security, and other necessities and comforts of life. Though often subtle, these systems are everywhere in our world and, without exception, they impact all of us.

4A206E90DFE80131F60C68A86D17958E.description: Predict possible evolution scenarios for a modern piece of technology

4A203080DFE80131F60B68A86D17958E.description: Use tools to observe, measure, make things, and transfer information

4A1FF480DFE80131F60A68A86D17958E.description: Research how different groups in the world use technology

4A1FB3F0DFE80131F60968A86D17958E.description: Illustrate how technology has evolved throughout human history

4A1F4DD0DFE80131F60868A86D17958E.description: Determine that humans have always developed tools to communicate, build, move things, and reshape their environment to meet their wants and needs

4A1EF930DFE80131F60768A86D17958E.description: Explain that the purpose of a designed object is to solve a problem or enhance the quality of life

4A1EB520DFE80131F60668A86D17958E.description: Conclude that technology cannot always satisfy every human want and need

4A1E7090DFE80131F60568A86D17958E.description: Realize that all humans engage in technological activities; therefore, everyone is a technologist

4A1E2BF0DFE80131F60468A86D17958E.description: Discover that technology is know-how that extends human capabilities to solve problems or enhances the quality of life while science helps us to discover what is natural

4A1DE130DFE80131F60368A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will understand that technology is an extension of human capability.
comments: As long as there have been people, there has been technology. Indeed, the techniques of shaping tools are taken as the chief evidence of the beginning of human culture. On the whole, technology has been a powerful force in the development of civilization, all the more so as its link with science has been forged. Technology-like language, ritual, values, commerce, and the arts-is an intrinsic part of a cultural system and it both shapes and reflects the system's values. In today's world, technology is a complex social enterprise that includes not only research, design, and crafts but also finance, manufacturing, management, labor, marketing, and maintenance.
